column4: I am sitting on a network with 2 other computer, both on Windows XPSP2 OS, and instead of installing my printer, cause its evil and doesn't want to be on my machine, I am going to install it to one of the windows machines... will I still have use of my printer with it being on another machine?
Yes, but you'll have to set up printer sharing on the machine it's connected to.
Ok can I ask for some guidance on how to do this?
I can help with the Ubuntu side of it... :)
Lol... that'll be good enough... I recently switched to Linux so I am just learning how to operate it... but I know Windows like the back of my hand
you still there?
yup
So you gonna help me with the Ubuntu part of it? lol
Ready if you are.
Yep, I got all the time in the world
Okay... it should be fairly straightforward.  Go to 'System' -> 'Administration' -> 'Printing'
Ok
I got that
From the 'Printer' menu, select 'new printer' -> 'windows printer (SMB)'
(you'll have to select 'network printer')
And then fill in the textboxes as required.  Some of that might be auto-detected.
Cool... alright I think I can handle it from here... thanks alot
Cool :)
Just one more question... once it is installed on the other machine... will I need the driver to use the printer or can I just tell the printer to print and it will work?
It shouldn't require the driver, as it's not operating the device... windows is doing that, the ubuntu box is just sending the printable data.
Sweet... again thanks alot lol... I really needed the use of this printer or it was my ass tomorrow at work lol... much appreciated... later
Anyone know how to install Yahelinux on this OS?
you still in here?
